lexUnit.name: confine.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: keep or restrict someone or something within certain limits of (space, scope, or time).

sentence.text: Traps should wither kill them instantly or confine them for release elsewhere .
He confined 340 mutineers in Burford Church for the next three days under general sentence of death .
The Byzantines confined it , for a period , to an area of the Black Sea coast in what is now Bulgaria .
My senses took me through the bars that confined me .
But even if magnetic fields could confine the wind , the hot gas pressure would be expected to build until it was episodically released as in a pressure cooker .
At first sight , the location of protest sub stantially among Romania 's alien ated Hungarian minority suggests that it may be more easily confined by the leadership in Bucharest .
First , all the activity may be confined to the summit crater at the top of the volcano , just where one might expect it to be .
So far , the debate about economic policy has been confined largely to technocrats and foreign advisers lodged in expensive hotels where one night costs around the average worker 's monthly wage .
Such terms are best confined to an appendix .
I have deliberately confined most of the detailed consideration in this study to the north bank of the Tyne .
The Royal Commission on Police Powers would have confined this to " grave offences . "
` Especially as once we start , we can never confine ourselves to just kissing , " Luke quipped with harsh humour , and paused .
His skin had an olive hue , signifying foreign blood , and his indecently long hair was very black , worn in a multitude of thin braids and confined at the back of his neck .
He escaped to France , but was captured after attempting another murder and confined in an asylum .
The plume of smoke is safely confined to the lower atmosphere , which means that it is soon mixed with fresh air and removed from the sky by rain .
Thus , corals are essentially tropical and virtually confined within 30 degrees of the equator .
Older people are not confined , when cared for in an acute hospital , to the geriatrics department ; they are the single largest patient group for most major medical specialisms .
He was n't confined indoors .
And my people , the men and maidservants who came running , he confined as you see , each in a glass bottle , and finally closed me into the glass coffin in which you found me .

As a breeding bird the Mallard is widely distributed throughout the county and not always confined to wet habitats ; breeding has been established in several downland localities , for example Rewell Wood .
These benefits are not confined to mortgage interest relief and pension contribution relief ; there are over a hundred .
